intro: Cassia sincorana, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and long, drooping clusters of yellow flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Cassia sincorana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
